sentences.english: But outside the studio, he isn't good with real people.
sentences.chinese: 但是離開演播室，他在生活中與人相處得不好。

sentences.english: We're now going back to the studio.
sentences.chinese: 現在我們回到電視演播室。

sentences.english: She and Steven were at the studio.
A photographic showcase of advertising photography, both studio and location work.
sentences.chinese: 一個廣告攝影，演播室和位置的攝影作品展示。

sentences.english: One day，the boy and the girl were both invited to appear on a television interview program.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，他們被一家電視臺邀請到了演播室。

sentences.english: Politicians recite their liturgies in TV studios.
sentences.chinese: 政客們在電視演播室裏朗誦禱文。

sentences.english: Each studio has its own transmitter. Earlier on the studios were located at the second floor.
sentences.chinese: 每一個演播室都有自己的發射機。

sentences.english: So glad you could come to the studio.
sentences.chinese: 很高興您能來到我們的演播室。

sentences.english: Don't you have to be at the studio?
Widely used for the situations of stage, film, multi-functions meeting room, News reporting hall.
sentences.chinese: 廣泛適用於舞臺，電影，多功能會議室，新聞演播室。

sentences.english: The group also toured China. org. cn's multilingual newsroom and multimedia studio.
sentences.chinese: 隨後，新聞官員們參觀了中國網多媒體演播室。

sentences.english: Was the hotel near the studio?
In this scenario, Jobs is a mogul straight out of the studio system.
sentences.chinese: 在這種情況下，喬布斯成了走出演播室系統的大亨。

definition: to direct a television or radio broadcast/director (TV, radio)

live relay/broadcast of actual scene/to broadcast live
